headline.seo: In New York City, Giving Away, and Taking Away, Condoms
headline.main: Giving Away, and Then Seizing, Condoms

docs.snippet: New York City gives people condoms, while the police confiscate them from those most vulnerable to sexually transmitted diseases....
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on irony of New York City health workers giving away millions of condoms in an effort to stem the spread of disease, while city's police officers confiscate condoms from prostitutes during arrests and send them back onto the streets defenseless.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York City gives people condoms, while the police confiscate them from those most vulnerable to sexually transmitted diseases.

headline.print_headline: Beckett and Ortiz Pace Red Sox; Price Pitches Rays Past Angels
headline.seo: Josh Beckett and David Ortiz Lead Red Sox Past Twins
headline.main: Beckett and Ortiz Pace Red Sox; Price Pitches Rays Past Angels

docs.snippet: The cure for Boston’s recent problems? Six sharp innings from Beckett, and a home run by Ortiz....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Boston Red Sox defeat Minnesota Twins, 11-2; other results noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: The cure for Boston’s recent problems? Six sharp innings from Beckett, and a home run by Ortiz.

headline.print_headline: Maryland: Judge Requests Reports On Leaks’ Damage
headline.seo: Maryland: Judge Requests Reports on WikiLeaks Damage
headline.main: Maryland: Judge Requests Reports on Leaks’ Damage

docs.snippet: A military judge ordered Army prosecutors to provide assessments of the potential damage caused by the online publication of secrets that Pfc. Bradley Manning is accused of leaking....

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Military Judge Col Denise Lind orders Army prosecutors to provide assessments of the potential damage caused by the online publication of government secrets that Pfc Bradley Manning is accused of providing to WikiLeaks.
docs.lead_paragraph: A military judge ordered Army prosecutors to provide assessments of the potential damage caused by the online publication of secrets that Pfc. Bradley Manning is accused of leaking.

headline.print_headline: Case of Mad Cow Disease Is Found in U.S.
headline.seo: Case of Mad Cow Disease Is Found in U.S.
headline.main: Case of Mad Cow Disease Is Found in U.S.

docs.snippet: The infected dairy cow in central California never posed a danger to consumers, as milk does not transmit the disease, the chief veterinarian of the Department of Agriculture said....
docs.abstract: Department of Agriculture announces that it has identified a case of mad cow disease in a dairy cow in central California; case is first in six years; agency says the cow never posed a danger to consumers, as milk does not transmit the disease.
docs.lead_paragraph: The infected dairy cow in central California never posed a danger to consumers, as milk does not transmit the disease, the chief veterinarian of the Department of Agriculture said.

headline.print_headline: California: Land Swap Ends Long Fight Over Cross
headline.main: California: Land Swap Ends Long Fight Over Cross

docs.snippet: A veterans group can restore a cross in the Mojave Desert under a settlement that ends a decade-old legal battle, the National Park Service said Tuesday....
docs.abstract: National Parks Service says the Veterans of Foreign Wars can restore a cross in the Mojave Desert under a settlement that ends a decade-old legal battle; Mojave National Preserve will give up the acre of land in exchange for five acres of privately owned property within the park's boundaries.
docs.lead_paragraph: A veterans group can restore a cross in the Mojave Desert under a settlement that ends a decade-old legal battle, the National Park Service said Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Israel Retroactively Legalizes 3 Settlements in West Bank
headline.seo: Israel Retroactively Legalizes 3 West Bank Settlements
headline.main: Israel Retroactively Legalizes 3 West Bank Settlements

docs.snippet: The provocative move, defended by the Netanyahu government as merely fixing technical issues, marked the first establishment of new settlements in two decades....
docs.abstract: Israel retroactively legalizes three Jewish settlement outposts in the West Bank and moves to delay the scheduled evacuation of a fourth; United States and other foreign governments immediately raise concerns about the move, which some critics say is the first establishment of new settlements in two decades.
docs.lead_paragraph: The provocative move, defended by the Netanyahu government as merely fixing technical issues, marked the first establishment of new settlements in two decades.

headline.print_headline: Texas: Fiancé of Suspect Thought She Had Given Birth
headline.main: Texas: Fiancé of Suspect Thought She Had Given Birth

docs.snippet: The fiancé of the woman charged with fatally shooting a mother from the Houston area and stealing her 3-day-old child said he thought that she had given birth in Galveston weeks earlier....
docs.abstract: Kevin Carter, fiance of Verna McClain who is charged with fatally shooting Kala Marie Golden of Spring, Tex, and stealing her 3-day-old child, says he thought McClain had given birth in Galveston weeks earlier and that the baby was being treated in a hospital.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fiancé of the woman charged with fatally shooting a mother from the Houston area and stealing her 3-day-old child said he thought that she had given birth in Galveston weeks earlier.

docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Department lawyers have requested a delay in the trial over the Texas voter identification law, saying the state has repeatedly blocked requests for information.

headline.print_headline: Power Struggle Between Leaders of Players Association Creates Chaos
headline.seo: Leaders of N.B.A. Players Union in Power Struggle
headline.main: Struggle Between Leaders of Players Union Creates Chaos

docs.snippet: A call for audit puts the players association’s president, Derek Fisher, and the union’s longtime executive director Billy Hunter at odds....
docs.abstract: NBA Players Assn president Derek Fisher is demanding a far-ranging audit of the union's finances, staffing and business practices, a move that is being viewed as assault on longtime executive director Billy Hunter, who has hired a number of his family members over the years.
docs.lead_paragraph: A call for audit puts the players association’s president, Derek Fisher, and the union’s longtime executive director Billy Hunter at odds.

headline.main: An Early Exit and Possible Shake-Up
